description.narrative: 5.1. By 2021, National, sub-national and community-level education stakeholders have strengthened capacity to increase access to quality, age-appropriate early learning opportunities in targeted provinces

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 5.1. By 2021, National, sub-national and community-level education stakeholders have strengthened capacity to increase access to quality, age-appropriate early learning opportunities in targeted provinces

description.narrative: Expansion of the community based integrated ECD – the Insaka programme, slowed down in the first half of 2020 due to COVID-19, reaching 1,809 caregivers through face to face counselling in nurturing care and playful parenting and 1,334 children accessing services. Continued multisectoral collaboration resulted in alternative approaches for delivering parenting education using radio and video methods. Additionally, this also resulted in a joint effort in the launch of the national playful parenting campaign which contributed to advocacy and promotion of nurturing care. The commencement of developing the ECE GPE programme presents an opportunity for strategic planning for ECE. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:30/06/2020

title.narrative: Service Delivery - Early learning - ECD facilitators/teachers who received training with funding provided by UNICEF
